current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To extend assistance to certain private nonprofit
		  facilities following a disaster, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Homeland Security and
			 Governmental Affairs

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended to read as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 102(11)(B) of the Robert T.
			 Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act/s:102/p:11/sp:B
Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act/s:102/p:11/sp:A

term.#tail:
includes any
				private nonprofit facility that provides essential services to the general
				public (including museums, zoos, performing arts facilities, community arts
				centers, community centers, houses of worship, libraries, homeless shelters,
				senior citizen centers, rehabilitation facilities, shelter workshops, and
				facilities that provide health and safety services of a governmental nature),
				as defined by the

text.#text: In addition to the facilities described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the
			 following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section
			 406(a)(3) of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance
			 Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act/s:406/ss:a/p:3

header.#text:
Repair,
			 restoration, and replacement of damaged facilities

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, without regard to the religious character of the facility or the
				primary religious use of the facility.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act/s:406/ss:a/p:1/sp:B

text.#text:
A church, synagogue, mosque, temple, or other house of
				worship, and an otherwise eligible private nonprofit facility operated by a
				religious organization, shall be eligible for contributions under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, in spaces used primarily for religious worship services,
				contributions under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act/s:406/ss:a/p:3/sp:C/cl:i

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall only be used to cover costs of
				purchasing or replacing, without limitation, the building structure, building
				enclosure components, building envelope, vertical and horizontal circulation,
				physical plant support spaces, electrical, plumbing, and mechanical systems
				(including heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and fire and life safety
				systems), and related site
				improvements.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act/s:406/ss:a/p:1/sp:B

text.#text:
This
			 section and the amendments made by this section shall apply to the provision of
			 assistance in response to a major disaster or emergency declared on or after
			 October 28, 2012.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1274 IS: To extend assistance to certain private nonprofit facilities following a disaster, and for other purposes.
